p: In sporadic and familial AD, U1 snRNP subunits – including U1-70K and U1A – were present in cytoplasmic aggregates, which occurs by the basic-acidic dipeptide (BAD) domain binding to tau in U1-70K ( Bishof et al., 2018). Inordinate levels of unspliced RNA also reside, caused by dysregulation of RNA processing. In conjunction with evidence that inhibition of U1 snRNP increases APP, this implicates U1 snRNP dysregulation in the pathogenesis of AD ( Bai et al., 2013; Hales et al., 2014a, b). Recent evidence has shown abnormal expression of U1 snRNA can cause premature cleavage of pre-mRNA via polyadenylation (PCPA) at the 3′ poly-A site. This affects splicing and could demonstrate a novel AD causing pathology ( Cheng et al., 2017) ( Table 3).
